### Expected
With Markdown enabled: make a change in the Edit tab, immediately switch to the Preview tab and see the formatted change or a loading indicator.

### Observed
With Markdown enabled: make a change in the Edit tab, immediately switch to the Preview tab and see *no change* and no loading indicator.

### Reproduced
> 1. Create and open a new note.
> 2. Enable Markdown in the overflow menu.
> 3. Make an edit in the Edit tab.
> 4. Immediately switch to the Preview tab, and the content has not updated.
> 5. Return to Edit tab.
> 6. Make a new edit.
> 7. Wait a few seconds and switch to the Preview tab, and the content has updated.

issues.title: Sync: Remote changes to tags are always reverted
issues.body:
### Expected
I expect that my most recent changes to the tags on a note will always be saved and synced, whether the change was made locally or on another device.

### Observed
Opening a note in the Android app's note editor always syncs the local tags to other devices, even if tags were added/removed on another device more recently.

### Reproduced

1. Create a note in the Android app.
2. Add a tag to the note.
3. With the note open in the Android app, open the note on another device (I tested with both web and iOS clients) and confirm the tag is visible.
4. On the other device, add a tag.
5. Notice that after the note syncs, the newly added tag is removed.
6. In the Android app, go back to the note list.
7. On the other device, add the new tag again and notice that it stays added (and syncs to other non-Android clients).
8. In the Android app, open the note again. Notice that the new tag isn't visible in the Android app and, after the note syncs, it is removed again on the other device.

You can also repeat the steps, removing a tag instead of adding one, with the same results.

Make|Model|Android Version|App Version
-|-|-|-
Motorola|moto e5 play|8.1.0|2.7-rc-1

Tested using Simplenote iOS 4.19 and Simplenote Electron 1.16.0-2078 (on macOS/Chrome) as the other device.

issues.title: Creating notes without an account can result in losing notes
issues.body:
When you first open the Android app after downloading it there's an option at the bottom of the screen to "just try the app". 

![aa7e7306-09f4-11e5-943a-b067925e08ab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7946521/7961383/30c9f3ae-09ff-11e5-8d9f-d8be0caed6c1.png)

This will let users create notes without signing into, or creating, an account. If they later create a new account in the app the notes are copied into it. However if they sign into an existing account, the notes that were created offline will appear on the device but they never appear in the same account when signing in through a web browser. If the user then signs out of their account on the device and signs back in again, all those "local notes" are lost.

I think it might be better to remove the option to create notes without an account, or at the very least, provide a warning that signing into an account will result in notes being lost.

I hope this makes sense!

Ticket: https://simplenote.desk.com/agent/case/62933

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Stop note bucket on pause (#554)

Issue: Note is stale when app is resumed. New change on app will
overwrite the server version. There are duplicate issues opened.

- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/350
- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/290
- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/243

Step to reproduce:

1. Open a note and put it in the background.
2. Make change to the same note from web or other client
3. Bring the simplenote android app to the foreground.

Expected: New changes should appear.
Actual:   No change from the server. Editing note on Android will
          overwrite the server version.

This is because the app does not sync note from server on resume.

Changes: Stop bucket on pause so that bucket could be started correctly
onResume.

Also see https://simperium.com/docs/reference/android/#bucket-stop,
> It's recommended to "stop" (typo on the actual web page) buckets in
> activities or fragments in the onPause() method.

Tested: Perform the above repro steps and get the expected behavior.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Stop note bucket on pause (#554)

Issue: Note is stale when app is resumed. New change on app will
overwrite the server version. There are duplicate issues opened.

- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/350
- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/290
- https://github.com/Automattic/simplenote-android/issues/243

Step to reproduce:

1. Open a note and put it in the background.
2. Make change to the same note from web or other client
3. Bring the simplenote android app to the foreground.

Expected: New changes should appear.
Actual:   No change from the server. Editing note on Android will
          overwrite the server version.

This is because the app does not sync note from server on resume.

Changes: Stop bucket on pause so that bucket could be started correctly
onResume.

Also see https://simperium.com/docs/reference/android/#bucket-stop,
> It's recommended to "stop" (typo on the actual web page) buckets in
> activities or fragments in the onPause() method.

Tested: Perform the above repro steps and get the expected behavior.
